title: Stop Join Future from doing the same submit multiple times.
body:
* [x] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG_VULKANO.md` or `CHANGELOG_VK_SYS.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* [ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository
* [ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR.

The implementation of `build_submission `in JoinFuture called queue submits of joined futures directly. Since the `build_submission` contract allows it to be called mutiple times that could lead to submits being duplicated. Amongst others this leads to vulkan validation layer errors as seen in #1294, which should be fixed with this.

This fix replaces the direct submit calls by a flush of the appropriate joined futures. This is similar to the approach taken in `PresentFuture` and as far as I can tell is in line with the contracts of `build_submission` and `flush`. I ran all tests and examples to do some basic validation and saw no issues.

title: Prevent building a GraphicsPipeline with a NULL handle.
body:
* [ ] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG_VULKANO.md` or `CHANGELOG_VK_SYS.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* [ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository
* [ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR.

I've found that the Adreno driver on Android returns a NULL handle from `vkCreateGraphicsPipelines` if invalid shaders are passed to a pipeline (for example, shaders that exceed the limits of GPU). The current behavior of Vulkano is to ignore this and create a Vulkano `GraphicsPipeline` instance with a NULL handle, this causes lots of weird and hard to debug issues later on in the application including crashes inside the graphics driver.

This change simply adds a panic if this case is detected, so the rest of the program cannot proceed with an invalid `GraphicsPipeline`.

title: Sendable DebugCallback
body:
* [x] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG_VULKANO.md` or `CHANGELOG_VK_SYS.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* [ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository
* [ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR.

On the `master` branch the `DebugCallback` struct can not be sent between threads due to the `user_callback` field being non `Send`able. 

It's useful to be able to instantiate Vulkano on one thread and then send the instances to a worker thread for use, but right now this would require the worker thread to instantiate it's own `DebugCallback`, which could cause two to be registered at the same time which results in double logging. 

This change simply adds the `Send` trait bound to the `user_callback` field to fix this. The `DebugCallback::new` function already required the `Send` trait bound, so I do not believe this can break any existing code. I also don't believe this introduces any unsoundness since the field is only there to keep the callback object alive. 

Including error to aid searchability:
```
error[E0277]: `(dyn for<'r, 's> std::ops::Fn(&'r instance::debug::Message<'s>) + 'static)` cannot be sent between threads safely
   --> vulkano/src/instance/debug.rs:356:9
    |
356 |         thread::spawn(move || {
    |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ `(dyn for<'r, 's> std::ops::Fn(&'r instance::debug::Message<'s>) + 'static)` cannot be sent between threads safely
    |
    = help: the trait `std::marker::Send` is not implemented for `(dyn for<'r, 's> std::ops::Fn(&'r instance::debug::Message<'s>) + 'static)`
    = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `std::marker::Send` for `std::ptr::Unique<(dyn for<'r, 's> std::ops::Fn(&'r instance::debug::Message<'s>) + 'static)>`
    = note: required because it appears within the type `std::boxed::Box<(dyn for<'r, 's> std::ops::Fn(&'r instance::debug::Message<'s>) + 'static)>`
    = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `std::marker::Send` for `std::ptr::Unique<std::boxed::Box<(dyn for<'r, 's> std::ops::Fn(&'r instance::debug::Message<'s>) + 'static)>>`
    = note: required because it appears within the type `std::boxed::Box<std::boxed::Box<(dyn for<'r, 's> std::ops::Fn(&'r instance::debug::Message<'s>) + 'static)>>`
    = note: required because it appears within the type `instance::debug::DebugCallback`
    = note: required because it appears within the type `std::result::Result<instance::debug::DebugCallback, instance::debug::DebugCallbackCreationError>`
    = note: required because it appears within the type `[closure@vulkano/src/instance/debug.rs:356:23: 358:10 callback:std::result::Result<instance::debug::DebugCallback, instance::debug::DebugCallbackCreationError>]`
```

title: fix descriptor set codegen for SSBO after spirv update
body:
* [x] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG_VULKANO.md` or `CHANGELOG_VK_SYS.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* [ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository
* [ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR.

The upgrade to spirv 1.3 lead to bugs in the `shader!` around buffers in descriptor sets.

The `BufferBlock` decoration is deprecated (see https://www.khronos.org/registry/spir-v/specs/unified1/SPIRV.html#_a_id_decoration_a_decoration) and the new way is to use the storage class on the variable.

Tested in the basic-compute-shader example, which I also modified to require the `khr_storage_buffer_storage_class` extension when initialising.

title: update shader include resolution to fix issues with windows
body:
* [x ] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG_VULKANO.md` or `CHANGELOG_VK_SYS.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* [ x] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository
* [ ] ~~Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR.~~

This change in the behaviour of shader includes in order to make it consistent against the command line `glslc` from shaderc, and make it work on Windows.

* Remove the use of canonicalize - this is the source of windows issues, and results in incorrect behaviour when symlinks are used.
* Include folders are relative to `Cargo.toml` for consistency with the paths to shaders
* Don't check for includes going outside their path - this is allowed by `glslc` so should be allowed here

title: Publish version 0.14.0.
body:
This is kind of a delayed emergency release to address an issue where
some Linux distributions (Arch, Void and perhaps others) are unable to
build any projects depending on vulkano-shaders due to
google/shaderc-rs#58. This is resolved in shaderc 0.6 and in turn will
be resolved in vulkano 0.14 thanks to #1226.

title: support for compressed formats in check_copy_buffer_image
body:
* [x ] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG_VULKANO.md` or `CHANGELOG_VK_SYS.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* [x ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository
* [ ] ~Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR.~

This is my take on supporting compressed formats in check_copy_buffer_image.
* Texture Formats now have a 2d block size. For non block formats this is simply (1,1)
* The size is now given as the size of a block (so for 1x1 blocks this is still the element size)
* The destination size check rounds up the image dimensions to the nearest block before calculating buffer size.

All the block dimensions and sizes taken from https://www.khronos.org/registry/DataFormat/specs/1.1/dataformat.1.1.html

title: Fix `ImageDimensions::mipmap_dimensions` and `max_mipmaps` where the original size is not a power of two.
body:
* [x] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG_VULKANO.md` or `CHANGELOG_VK_SYS.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* [x] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository
* [x] ~Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR.~ (No reference to this function in the guide.)

---

Mipmap sizes are not rounded up to the nearest power of two ([source](https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.1/html/chap11.html#resources-image-miplevel-sizing)), so `.next_power_of_two()` shouldn't be there. It happens to produce the correct result when the preceding calculation produces a power of two, but only because it doesn't do anything.

In addition, the `((width - 1) >> level) + 1` trick is cool, but it will always round up instead of down, which is also incorrect. It happens to produce the correct result when the original size is an even number, but only because it doesn't need to round after dividing by 2.

Scrapping both and replacing them with a call to `cmp::max()` is correct for all image sizes.

Here's one of the validation errors I have when trying to blit to the first mipmap of an image with a size of 192x256 px:

> Object: 0x29505b92840 (Type = 6) | vkCmdBlitImage(): region [0] dstOffset[].x values (0, 128) exceed dstSubresource width extent (96). The Vulkan spec states: dstOffset[0].x and dstOffset[1].x must both be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to the destination image subresource width (https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.1-extensions/html/vkspec.html#VUID-VkImageBlit-dstOffset-00248)

title: Update shaderc to 0.6 in order to significantly reduce compile-times …
Remove assert that was based on bad assumption
body:
* [x] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG_VULKANO.md` or `CHANGELOG_VK_SYS.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* ~[ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository~
* ~[ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR~

This pull request addresses issue #960 

The assumption that the fence must already be signalled is incorrect. There is nothing in the Vulkan spec regarding `VkAcquireNextImageInfoKHR` that says what order the fence and semaphore are signalled in, or that they are signalled at exactly the same time from the API users perspective.

title: Fix dyn warnings on nightly
body:
* [x] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG_VULKANO.md` or `CHANGELOG_VK_SYS.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* [x] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository
* [x] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR.

Used rustfix to do this painlessly.

title: Release vulkano 0.13
body:
* [x] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG_VULKANO.md` or `CHANGELOG_VK_SYS.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* [ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository
* [ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR.

I'll merge this tonight.
I might do a quick PR beforehand, to fix all the new `dyn` warnings that appear on nightly now.

title: rustc is now making use of the fact that derefencing a null pointer is UB. Remove all null dereferences
body:
* [ ] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG_VULKANO.md` or `CHANGELOG_VK_SYS.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* [x] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository
* [x] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR.

Uh oh..
rustc is now making use of the fact that derefencing a null pointer is UB.
So we need to remove all null dereferences, of which there are surprisingly large amount of. In order to get vulkano working AT ALL on nightly and presumably soon beta + stable.

@tomaka You have a pretty good idea what is and isnt UB. Why did you write these null dereferences, is there something you needed from them that I am missing?

Fixes https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano/issues/1207

title: Add function execute_commands_from_vec to accept multiple command buffers from a vector.
Propagate newlines correctly on error messages
body:
This resolves #345 for me. It's not ideal as I think the fix can happen upstream in shaderc, however this provides a more mature way to deal with error output. If it's appropriate or there is interest I can add color/bold terminal codes to make the error output more clear.

I'm a bit confused exactly what is happening here. I believe the issue is in shaderc. This is also bit of a hacky fix to correct the output of shaderc so there is a newline after the initial `message: 22 compilation error(s):` 

The newline characters are outputting on my Linux terminal, but they're not actually causing a newline to happen? I tried it every which way and this is the simplest solution which works for me.

When I have more time I will try and fix this upstream in shaderc.

title: Add support for VK_KHR_16bit_storage and VK_KHR_storage_buffer_storage_class
body:
This pull request introduces six new SPIR-V capabilities and one new SPIR-V storage class according to [SPV_KHR_16bit_storage](https://www.khronos.org/registry/spir-v/extensions/KHR/SPV_KHR_16bit_storage.html) and [SPV_KHR_storage_buffer_storage_class](https://www.khronos.org/registry/spir-v/extensions/KHR/SPV_KHR_storage_buffer_storage_class.html).

Additionally, it allows them to require the corresponding Vulkan device extensions [VK_KHR_16bit_storage](https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.0-extensions/html/vkspec.html#VK_KHR_16bit_storage) and [VK_KHR_storage_buffer_storage_class](https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.0-extensions/html/vkspec.html#VK_KHR_storage_buffer_storage_class). New definitions have been added to vk-sys.

The guide does not need to be updated.

* [x] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users
* [x] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - in this repository
* [ ] Updated documentation to reflect any user-facing changes - PR to the [guide](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www) that fixes existing documentation invalidated by this PR.

title: Decouple descriptor sets from pipeline
body: Resolves #1002.
